pages.text: When working with $(aura), sometimes it can be beneficial to know about its levels in an area without having to be there to check in person. The $(item)Aura Detector$() gives out a $(thing)redstone$() signal based on the amount of $(aura) in the close vicinity around it, so long as you attach a $(item)Comparator$() to it. For that, its range of display is similar to that of the $(l:items/eye)Environmental Eye$().
